questions.question: What are the primary differences between DHCP and the earlier Bootstrap Protocol (BOOTP)?

options.a: DHCP supports static IP address allocation, while BOOTP only supports dynamic allocation.
options.b: DHCP operates on ports 67 and 68, whereas BOOTP operates on ports 53 and 54.
options.c: DHCP allows for easier configuration and supports mobility, while BOOTP requires manual configuration.
options.d: DHCP was developed after BOOTP and includes additional security features.
